content.description:
Start up a series of flakes trending left to join a shallow right-facing corner system which becomes more pronounced higher to a small ledge, rest up, and then launch up the short but steep two bolt headwall (crux) to anchors.

The climbing is mostly 5.10 or so as you stem and lieback your way to the bouldery and surprisingly pumpy crux section. Although it's a little crunchy in spots more traffic should help to clean it up.
content.location:
Far right side of the Shield; 3 routes right of

Spunky Monkey

.

content.description:
Route begins in a right-facing corner and continues up and slightly right through blocky terrain. Continue up and right of two shallow flake/ramp systems to the sixth bolt. After clipping this move left to join

Exfoliator

at its eighth bolt. Steep climbing in the final section.

In its current state, this rig is super sketchy dangerous. At the base of the dihedral, there's a huge flake that was heavily glued but the glue is broken and completely separated from the wall and the entire thing is barely on there wiggling and ready to chop you up!!!!

If you look at the pic in the newest guidebook, look below the climber and you will see said flake but when it was "safely" adhered to the wall...

The route has other issues as well. Maybe a crowbar and serious brush mission could clean it up...IDK

This is an alternate start that links up with Anger Management.  Climb the sustained and balancy face until you reach a crux deadpoint/dyno at the 6th bolt.  The hold you are going for is blind and is located about a foot to the right of the 7th bolt.  After sticking the dyno, clip and climb through 2 more bolts of thin and powerful moves.  The route joins Anger Management at the arching undercling traverse.
content.location: Located right of Anger Management and shares the shares the start of Exfoliator

content.description: A challenging and balancy opening section leads to a rest under a steep and powerful section half way up the route.  Pull the first crux to gain access to the rest ledge above.  A final powerful and sustained section leads to the anchors.  The route gets dirty quickly after a rain, so bring a brush.

Easy moves off the ground lead to a thin traverse right at the 2nd bolt. Continue up on awkward right facing flakes for a while. A bad sequence early on can make getting to the 4th bolt much harder. A high crimp crux, which is a touch reachy, leads to fun and easier climbing to the anchors.
content.location:
Start on a right leaning crack. This is a few routes to the right of

Megalomania

and just left of Spunk Monkey.

content.description: Excellent mix of technical and power climbing.  The two main cruxes are found when pulling the two obvious bulges on the bottom section of the route.  The lower angle sections of rock have much smaller holds and require a lot of balance.
content.location: Located right of Agression Supression and left of Infatuation.  There is a pile of cheater stones at the base.
